018package org.opengis.filter.capability;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import org.opengis.util.LocalName;
023import org.opengis.util.TypeName;
024import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
025import org.opengis.parameter.ParameterDescriptor;
026
027import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.OPTIONAL;
028import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
029import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
030
031
032/**
033 * A function that may be used in filter expressions.
034 * The description of each function includes a declaration of the return type,
035 * the list of arguments with optional names and expected types.
036 *
037 * @author  Torsten Friebe (lat/lon)
038 * @author  Justin Deoliveira (The Open Planning Project)
039 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
040 * @version 3.1
041 *
042 * @see FilterCapabilities#getFunctions()
043 *
044 * @since 3.1
045 */
046@UML(identifier="AvailableFunctions", specification=ISO_19143)
047public interface AvailableFunction {
048    /**
049     * Returns the function name.
050     *
051     * @return the function name.
052     */
053    @UML(identifier="name", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
054    LocalName getName();
055
056    /**
057     * Returns the type of return value.
058     *
059     * @return the type of return value.
060     *
061     * @departure integration
062     *   OGC/ISO defines the return type as {@link org.opengis.util.ScopedName}.
063     *   However this is at odd with other classes returning type information,
064     *   which use {@code TypeName}.
065     */
066    @UML(identifier="returns", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
067    TypeName getReturnType();
068
069    /**
070     * Returns the list of arguments expected by the function.
071     *
072     * <h4>Unified parameter API</h4>
073     * In GeoAPI, the {@code Argument} type defined by ISO 19143 is replaced by {@link ParameterDescriptor}
074     * in order to provide a single parameter API (see {@link org.opengis.parameter} for more information).
075     * The mapping from ISO 19143 to GeoAPI is defined in the following table.
076     * The equivalences are straightforward except for the types:
077     * {@code name} is mapped to an {@link org.opengis.metadata.Identifier} instead of {@link LocalName},
078     * and {@code type} is mapped to an {@link TypeName} instead of {@link org.opengis.util.ScopedName}.
079     *
080     * <table class="ogc">
081     *   <caption>Argument properties mapped to GeoAPI</caption>
082     *   <tr><th>{@code Argument} property</th> <th>{@code ParameterDescriptor} property</th></tr>
083     *   <tr><td>{@code name}</td> <td>{@link ParameterDescriptor#getName() name}</td></tr>
084     *   <tr><td>{@code type}</td> <td>{@link ParameterDescriptor#getValueType() valueType}</td></tr>
085     * </table>
086     *
087     * @departure harmonization
088     *   Usage of the ISO 19143 {@code Argument} type has been replaced by usage of the ISO 19111
089     *   {@code OperationParameter} type in order to provide a unified parameter API.
090     *
091     * @return arguments that the function accepts.
092     */
093    @UML(identifier="arguments", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
094    default List<? extends ParameterDescriptor<?>> getArguments() {
095        return Collections.emptyList();
096    }
097}
